works.complaint:
In New Zealand the Defamation Act 1992 and its  
provisions protect New Zealanders from Defamatory statements including  
Libel and Slander. The Blogger and comments upon the Blog in question  
states anti social behaviour and drug taking, all of which from being  
published have breached the Defamation Act 1992.
The Blogger Goes Above and Beyound a Held Honest Opinion and Directly  
states consumption of Methamphetamine by Myself.
In New Zealand to breach the Defamatory Act 1992 the Defendant must have
A. made a statement of which has been defamatory of you.
B. The statement must have been communicated to one or more people – in  
other words, there must have been "publication".

New Zealaners do not have to prove that they have suffered any specific  
damage or loss, as the law assumes that they have suffered loss if a  
statement is defamatory of them.

The Breaches of the Act of which the Blog does are related to:
Section 2 Defamation Act 1992.
Section 5 Defamation Act 1992.
Section 4 Defamation Act 1992.

And subsections of the Act.
